On Wokeness

Image Description: Woman with her hands touching her earrings.

"[To be woke] is an encouragement for people to wake up and question dogmatic social norms. It requires an active process of deprogramming social conditionings focusing on consistent efforts to challenge the universal infractions we are all subjected to."

—Raven Cras, "What does it mean to be "woke?"

The goal of this site is simple: to provide a way to educate yourself on your privileges and issues affecting different marginalized communities. Start exploring this site through the featured topics below or the other topics listed at the top of the page.

Featured Topics

Sexual Violence
End Rape Culture

It can be hard to talk about sexual assault — but every 98 seconds, someone is the victim of it. Learn about their stories and about what you can do to prevent more sexual violence.

Learn More
Racial Identity
Living as a Person of Color

Being a person of color in America often has its unique challenges. Learn about them and how you can be an ally.

Learn More
Feminism
We Should All Be Feminists

People often tend to misinterpret what feminism is. Learn more about the topic and ways to better support the equality of the sexes.

Learn More
